findings.title: Unlimited minting of sundae tokens
findings.description: The contract allows unlimited minting of Sundae tokens.

findings.title: Potential unauthorized script upgrade
findings.description: The codebase allows for potential unauthorized script upgrades due to incorrect naming conventions and inconsistencies.

findings.title: Fixed: Insecure use of SLOAD opcode
findings.description: Insecure use of SLOAD opcode can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Fixed: Unprotected function calls
findings.description: Unprotected function calls were fixed by adding checks to ensure proper method usage.

findings.title: Fixed: Potential reentrancy issue
findings.description: The fixed potential reentrancy issue arises from inadequate iteration over an array, which can lead to difficulties in determining the correct index and cause a reentrancy problem.

findings.title: Fixed: Lack of input validation
findings.description: The finding highlights the lack of input validation in the codebase, which can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Reentrancy vulnerability in `transferFee()` function
findings.description: A reentrancy vulnerability exists in the transferFee() function, allowing an attacker to drain the contract's funds.

findings.title: Unprotected use of `affect() and `end()` functions
findings.description: The unprotected use of `affect()` and `end()` functions can lead to unintended behavior and potential security risks.

findings.title: Insecure use of `MAX_PLATFORM_FEE` variable
findings.description: The insecure use of the MAX_PLATFORM_FEE variable can cause precision loss and lead to failure of _withdrawHealthCheck.
